Claus Michael Ringel

Abstract. Additive functions on translation quivers have played an important role in the
representation theory of finite dimensional algebras, the most prominent ones are the hammock
functions introduced by S. Brenner. When dealing with cluster categories (and cluster-tilted
algebras), one should look at a corresponding class of functions defined on stable translation
quivers, namely the cluster-additive ones. We conjecture that the cluster-additive functions on
a stable translation quiver of Dynkin type An ,Dn ,E6 ,E7 ,E8 are non-negative linear combinations
of cluster-hammock functions (with index set a tilting set). The present paper provides a first
study of cluster-additive functions and gives a proof of the conjecture in the case An .

F = τ −1 [1]. It may come as a surprise that instead of looking at Z∆/F , we prefer to consider cluster-additive functions on its cover Z∆. After all, every cluster-additive function
on Z∆/F lifts to a cluster-additive function on Z/∆, thus we deal with a setting which
on a fist sight appears to be more general. But we conjecture that all the cluster-additive
functions on Z/∆ actually are F -invariant, so that we would get the shift F for free.

typical features known in cluster theory (as started by Fomin and Zelevinsky and developed

immediately ... .
